file_content.text: We've arrived at the Belsavis spaceport.
Good. We'll have to work quickly if we're to find a cure for your strange ailment.
We know that a Sith called Darth Iratus suffered a similar problem. His power became too much for him and he began to deteriorate.
We also know that he went to Belsavis in search of a Rakata device that he believed could "fix" him. Whatever that means.
You haven't learned anything new about the device, then.
We don't know much.
Nothing beyond the diagrams Iratus himself left. I'm afraid technology isn't my area of expertise.
Who were these Rakata?
Rakata?
Little is known of them. They were highly advanced, and ruled the galaxy. Then they just disappeared.
Great. So let's get to the surface.
Blah blah. Let's go.
I wouldn't advise that. Not without a plan.
I've looked into Belsavis; there is indeed evidence that the Rakata were here and that they built some kind of monumental prison.
Master Ryen said something about a Republic prison. I'd never heard of these Rakata.
Indeed. The Republic built their own prison on top of the Rakata one. Whatever this device is, we'll have to navigate two prisons to get to it.
The Rakata on Belsavis! My friend, you trade in myths and wonders. Myths and wonders.
The Republic have arrived since, however, and built their own prison. Whatever this device is, we'll have to navigate two prisons to get to it.
We have to find the device first.
One step at a time.
That could pose an interesting challenge.
I'll destroy that prison piece by piece if I have to.
Whatever it takes.
Fortunately, that work has already begun.
How do we know this device hasn't been destroyed?
Is it still there?
Iratus's research is solid. I've checked it.
The Empire recently discovered the Republic's prison and staged a massive prison break.
Saves us the trouble of breaking in, I guess.
It also means the planet is in chaos, and any trail Darth Iratus left will have been obliterated.
If we don't have Darth Iratus to follow, we need to take another approach. Do you know any Rakata experts?
Let's try a different approach.
There's no such thing as a Rakata expert. Little is known of them and even less of it makes sense.
I don't need Darth Iratus's trail. Give me the information and I'll find the device.
If he could find it, I can.
Without a trail to follow or any field experts in ancient alien technology? You're good, but I don't know if you're that good.
I wonder what the Empire wants with Belsavis. It seems rather out of the way.
The Empire? Interesting.
I'm afraid I've been out of the loop too long to say.
But while perusing the Republic prison logs, I discovered a familiar name: the Circle. A group of criminal technologist Nikto I once employed.
They never met a system they couldn't slice or a machine they couldn't reverse-engineer. Perhaps they can interpret Darth Iratus's diagrams on Belsavis.
Then I will speak to them.
That's a plan, then.
A good start.
Do you know where they were being held?
Where can I find them?
Unfortunately, no.
I hope you're right about this.
This better work.
The Circle sliced into an ancient computer system that had the Empire's best paleotechnologists stumped. You won't find anyone better, on Belsavis or anywhere.
I bet one of the guard houses has a record of where they were kept. I've seen my share of prisons.
We must be careful. Belsavis is a place of unknown danger. But be quick. The dates on Darth Iratus's records show his condition worsening rapidly.
